chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
08-21-17/ Judge Michael Hanrahan        
The court ordered that the JOC be amended to reflect that the defendant is granted 23 days of additional sentence credit for a TOTAL of 101 days on counts one and two.,

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence. 
*12/16/2015 Honorable Janet C. Protasiewicz-credit amended to 78 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Complete Batterer's Intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

No further violations of the law.
No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
No contact with firearms.
Obtain/maintain full time emloyment. The defendant is to obtain employment within 30 days of release from confinement and complete at least 3 job applications per day.

supervisions.notes: COUNTS 1 & 2:  Pay all mandatory costs, surcharges and supervision fees within one year of release. Court ordered that all Court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

No contact with firearms.  Court advised defendant  of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable surcharges, and his voting rights are suspended.

records.addlTxt: Count two.
Count one

Defendant Larry Davis in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Larry Davis in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. 
AS TO COUNT 1 (amended):
Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with any other sentence; credit for 101 days served.  Court ordered 3 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 3 YEARS Extended Supervision.
AS TO COUNT 2 (amended):
Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 9 months in the House of Corrections, concurrent with any other sentence; credit for zero days served.  
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Establish and pay child support for all his children.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment. The defendant is to obtain employment within 30 days of release from confinement and complete at least 3 job applications per day.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all mandatory costs, surcharges and supervision fees within one year of release. Court orders no additional fine.
- Court set restitution at $500 payable to Artaedia E.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable surcharges, and his voting rights are suspended.
Order to Produce for Sentencing Hearing on August 26, 2015 @ 8:30am received and filed
Penalty enhancer "repeater" and "domestic abuse repeater" DISMISSED ON COUNT 2.
Penalty enhancer "repeater" and "domestic abuse repeater" DISMISSED ON COUNT 1.
and Restitution Worksheet, filed.

Defendant Larry Davis in court with Attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Larry Davis in custody. 
 Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

**CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 44 FOR BRANCH 40**

Matter before the Court for Plea Hearing.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The Court orders penalty enhancers "Repeater" and "Domestic Abuse Repeater" DISMISSED at this time.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.


AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion, the Court orders Counts 3 and 4 DISMISSED and READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Counts 1 and 2.

Defendant REMANDED into custody at this time.  Jury trial date of 10-14-15 vacated.  Case adjourned before Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case sent to Branch 44 for plea hearing as this court is in trial.  rmm

Defendant Larry Davis in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Larry Davis in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case numbers 11CF1196 and 08CM407 that are attached to the complaint.Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Department Officer Brian Flannery.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
